meanings.sent1: She enjoys burnishing her silver jewelry to make it shine.
meanings.sent2: The craftsman is burnishing the wooden table to give it a glossy finish.
meanings.sent3: After burnishing the old vase, it looked as good as new.
meanings.sent4: The sun burnishing the waves on the ocean created a mesmerizing sight.
meanings.sent5: The artist spent hours burnishing the sculpture to perfection.

meanings.definition: Improve or enhance (something) by making it more attractive or impressive.
meanings.sent1: He believes that a smile can burnish any conversation.
meanings.sent2: The new paint color will burnish the walls of the room beautifully.
meanings.sent3: Her laughter seemed to burnish the dull party atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The kind words from the teacher burnished the student's confidence.
meanings.sent5: The fresh flowers burnished the simple vase on the table.

meanings.definition: The action of polishing a surface by rubbing it.
meanings.sent1: The burnishing of the silver tray made it sparkle under the lights.
meanings.sent2: His burnishing of the car's exterior left it gleaming in the sun.
meanings.sent3: The burnishing of the trophy made it look even more prestigious.
meanings.sent4: The burnishing of the marble floor gave it a mirror-like finish.
meanings.sent5: The burnishing of the antique mirror revealed its true beauty.
